abstract: Google’s settlement of a shareholder lawsuit will most likely clear the way for the company to issue new nonvoting Class C shares. The move will perpetuate the control of Google by its co-founders, Sergey Brin and Larry Page, but may not be in shareholders’ best interests.
snippet: Google’s settlement of a shareholder lawsuit will most likely clear the way for the company to issue new nonvoting Class C shares. The move will perpetuate the control of Google by its co-founders, Sergey Brin and Larry Page, but may not be in sha...
lead_paragraph: Google and its co-founders, Sergey Brin and Larry Page, settled a shareholder lawsuit earlier this summer that most likely clears the way for Google to issue new nonvoting Class C shares. The settlement perpetuates the co-founders’ control, which is good for them, but it may not do much for Google’s shareholders, the majority of whom voted to oppose the maneuver.

headline.main: Google’s Stock Settlement May Not Do Much for Shareholders
